update.description:
* Allow multiple major versions of the library installed side by side.
* Optional version when doing `find_package`

All the projects that depend on ignition-transport should replace the way they search for this dependency.

Before:


```
#!c++
find_package(ignition-transport QUIET REQUIRED)
if (NOT ignition-transport_FOUND)
  BUILD_ERROR ("Missing: Ignition Transport (libignition-transport-dev)")
endif()
set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_CXX_FLAGS}")
include_directories(${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_INCLUDE_DIRS})
link_directories(${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_LIBRARY_DIRS})
```

After:


```
#!c++

find_package(ignition-transport0 0.8.0 QUIET REQUIRED)
if (NOT ignition-transport0_FOUND)
  BUILD_ERROR ("Missing: Ignition Transport (libignition-transport0-dev)")
endif()
set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_CXX_FLAGS}")
include_directories(${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_INCLUDE_DIRS})
link_directories(${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_LIBRARY_DIRS})
```

CI results:

* [Ubuntu trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-trusty-amd64/30/) happy.
* [Mac OS X](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/39/) happy.
* [Windows](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-amd64/56/) happy.

content.raw:
Not sure if there was a previous discussion or if there's an existing convention for this but I'd say that his approach have a few advantages:

* No need to consider in the code the special case of major version = 0.
* It offers an easier transition from version 0 to version 1 because it's evident for the users what they have to change in their CMakelists.txt (just replace the `0` with `1`).

But in any case we should do the same in all the libraries.
content.html:
Not sure if there was a previous discussion or if there's an existing convention for this but I'd say that his approach have a few advantages:

  • No need to consider in the code the special case of major version = 0.
  • It offers an easier transition from version 0 to version 1 because it's evident for the users what they have to change in their CMakelists.txt (just replace the 0 with 1).

But in any case we should do the same in all the libraries.

content.raw: I was also wondering about this for ign-common and ign-rendering. Looking at ign-math, I thought `${PROJECT_MAJOR_VERSION}` would only be appended if the version is > 1 - so we just removed the major version from the package name in rendering. Not sure what the convention is but I would like to follow whichever way we decide here.
